title: Firefox youtube loadning videos permanently
content:
Hi there, I have an issue with Nightly/Firefox. I have started to encounter that my youtube videos will not load (the circle goes around forever). I have tried deleting cookie, deleting all browsing history and to refresh and reinstall both firefox and nightly. Deleting cookies fixes the issues for maybe 20-40 minutes and then the videos stops loading again.

What causes this issue and what can I do to get a permanent solution? I like using Firefox, but I will NOT continue to use this browser if that means I have to reset my logins many times per day just to watch youtube videos.

title: Editing contact information in Firefox
content: It started when I tried to add a person to my contacts. An error message kept popping up which read lpe-data.errorSaveFailed. That problem seems to have gone away but I have a different problem. When I open my Contacts and click on a person's name their information appears OK on my screen. However, when I click on "Edit contact" to make a change, an error message pops up that says, "something went wrong. Please close this window and try again." I do that but nothing changes. Additionally, on my iPhone 11 which is synced to my Hotmail account a number of my accounts had their information duplicated to the point where some of them had up to 40 duplications. My thought was to delete Firefox from my computer and then reinstall it. When I went to do this, I noticed that there were two versions of the program on my computer, one of them installed August 26! I never installed it and I don't know how the second version got on m computer! Thinking that this duplication was the problem, I deleted the one installed on August 26 but kept the one installed a few years ago. Now I don't have any of my original bookmarks and the problem of making changes in a contact persists. Can someone guide me to a solution? Thank you in advance for your attention. bobinmelbourne@hotmail.com

title: problems with FF desktopweb browser
content:
hello,

There seems to be an annoying SCROLLING issue with the FACEBOOK.COM web page. It has been around a while (version 104.0 of FF here)

Google says this scrolling issue is in several browsers and is BROWSER CODING ISSUE with java script.........they mentions quik fixes like changing Facebook Font sizes..

Still,

as i gently scroll down facebook.com when logged in.......it will suddently SKIP POSTS and jitter.

THis jitter is very annoying indeed........

TRue, i have some of the FLAGS set in the config of FIREFOX and it could be some issue with those flags.....?

It could also be particular extensions of mine( in no particular order) which may be affecting things.....?

Sadly FF does not seem to offer a ------RESET TO DEFAULTS for "one pass"----- feature...... If it did offer it, users could do testing during that PASS......after which, a user could then 1) Re-start FF once again with his previuos custom settings back intact.

The only web browser i found WITHOUT this Facebook.com skipping issue is the latest OPERA Version:90.0.4480.54......... and i do indeed use the very same extensions on OPERA that i use in FF......... (so "extension issues" is unlikely to be the cause of the facebook skipping)

The questionable extensions of mine could be

1) Scrollanywhere 2) hide-scrollbars 3) and ADD BLOCKERS for youtube and twitch.

but i doubt it


The fact that FF do not seem aware of this facebook "scroll skipping issue" is embarrassing for them.

FB is one of the worlds largest web sites and FF is a "global web browser" so are millions sufferring this issue?

please look into this issue right away and if you discover it's your fault, then please sort this out right away.

i like millions of others wont use FF until this facebook issue is fixed.



Vince.
creator: briverybri

title: Trojan detected in favicons.sqlite-shm
content:
A Trojan was detected in favicons.sqlite-shm by BitDefender, the report said it blocked it (see screen-cap). Soon after, I wasn't able to load Firefox, Opera Browser and Thunderbird. Tying to access them would start a popup dialog box stating that"Firefox is already running" and I'd would be asked to either cancel or stop. Pressing either option wouldn't allow access to Firefox etc., I had my computer scanned professionally and was told they didn't think the Trojan was still active and they managed to restore access to Firefox and Thunderbird, this took 2 hours.

I remain unconvinced my computer is free of the Trojan for various issues, including a corrupted winload.efi file (I have already attempted and failed to fix this) that won't allow Windows Defender to scan in Offline mode. Various other issues such a slow applications and occasionally flickering screen suggests the Trojan might still be active.

I'd greatly appreciate if anyone has information or experience dealing with particular issue.

Scans such as, Kaspersky, Malwarebytes, Bitdefender, etc. have been run and found nothing.

title: Nem jeleníti meg a levelező rendszert.
content:
Üdv! Van egy nagy gondom remélem tudnak segíteni?! A Mozilla Firefox nem jeleníti meg az inda-mail fiókot belépve föl villannak a levelek egy pillanatra majd eltűnik az egész és csak tölt és tölt és más nem történik mi lehet a gond? Az Edge-n nem tapasztalok ilyen jellegű problémát. Segítségeteket előre is köszönöm! Tisztelettel; Mátyás Zsolt. Kedves Zsolt! Ezt a választ kaptam; Kipróbáltam egy eldobható fiókkal, és nálam minden megjelenik helyesen. Lehet hogy valami gyorsítótár-probléma, érdemes megpróbálni újratölteni az oldalt a Ctrl+Shift+R billentyűkombinációval.

Ha ez nem segít, akkor meg meg kell próbálni a Súgó -> Újraindítás letiltott kiegészítőkkel funkciót, hogy úgy is fennáll-e a probléma.

Üdv, Balázs 2 hónapja megoldódott a probléma ezért most ismét megpróbáltam de csak villog az oldal de nem történik semmi mi lehet a gond? Köszönöm ismét a segítséget! Üdv; Zsolt.

title: Problems with restoring a session properly.
content:
Hello,

This has been happening for the last several weeks, ever since I restored a lost session using the method shown here: https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1364444. I had done this without incident a few times before, but this time several new folders showed up in my profile folder, which I then (perhaps stupidly) deleted.

The problem is that whenever I restore a session after a crash or close, despite the session itself restoring to the correct place, the tab menu has several malfunctions:

- The tab menu defaults to the first tabs in each window, regardless of what tab I was on before the restore, and I cannot scroll beyond this because the scroll arrow does not appear. - Each tab appears with the x symbol, not only the one I am currently on. - When I click a tab, it "loads" forever and the website icon disappears, even if the content loads and is usable. - The address bar does not give suggested results when I type in it, though it is functional in all other ways. 

I have attached a screenshot of what this looks like.

These 'sessions' usually last only a short time before firefox crashes and the "bug" error box appears. When I tell firefox to restore, it brings up the restore session page, but the "restore" button is light blue and unclickable and "view previous tabs" is empty.

I have the same problem when I restore using the previous.jsonlz4 or recover.jsonlz4 files from immediately before the crash or close. I have noticed that there is no sessionstore.jsonlz4 file in my profile folder before restoring, which probably has something to do with the whole problem. I am able to open a previous.jsonlz4 file that I saved a month ago before the problem started without issue, but that means I obviously lose any tabs I opened in the interim.

Any help would be greatly appreciated, thank you.
creator: ldh00vt

title: Firefox slows down loading content on "endless" web pages
content:
When scrolling through web pages (such as Tumblr or Facebook), Firefox is fast at first. The longer I scroll, however, the slower the images and text load. Slow to the point I get flashbacks of AOL and 56K dial-up.

  • Dell 10th gen. i5 CPU, 16GB RAM, 1 TB SSD (I trim/defrag it on a regular basis).
  • Xfinity Internet. Speedtest averages 200Mbps or greater at around 13ms latency.
  • McAfee and Advanced System Care running as background processes.
  • System Resources for CPU and RAM are never over 60%; usually much lower.
  • Major add-ons are uBlock Origin and Facebook Container.

The problem seems to have gotten worse over the past several months.

Any ideas? Thanks in advance for your help.

title: Firefox not loading any websites after Windows crash
content:
My Windows PC apparently crashed when I tried to Hibernate. I knew this because when starting up the PC state was not persisted. I started Firefox (v97 x64) and it would not load any websites. The about:config page loaded.

I was at a loss as to how to resolve this as I could find no advice for this problem.

I thought I would try Safe Mode. Unexpectedly, just starting in Safe Mode resolved the issue without doing anything else. I am now back to normal.

I'm curious to know what just starting in Safe Mode did to resolve the issue. I also want to broadcast this as I did not find this as a potential solution.
